title: How to build Trilinos with cxxflags=-O3
body:
## Summary

The Trilinos build on Trinitite does not appear to accept the `cxxflags` directive in `compilers.yaml`. 

### Expected Result

With the `compilers.yaml` setting
```
    flags:
      cxxflags: -O3
```
we expected the Trilinos `build.out` file to record C++ compilations using the `-O3` flag. The 1101 C++ compilation and linking statements should look like this

`
.../bin/mpic++   ...  -DMUMPS_5_0 -std=c++11 -O3 -fPIC   .../Amesos_Status.cpp
`

Here is a shorthand version of the build log  [trilinos.build.out.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/1585072/trilinos.build.out.txt)

### Actual Result

While the Trilinos specification acknowledges the `cxxflags` setting,
```
$ spack spec trilinos   
...
Concretized
--------------------------------
trilinos@12.12.1%intel@17.0.4 cxxflags="-O3" ~alloptpkgs+amesos+amesos2+anasazi+aztec+belos+boost ...
```
the build log indicates defaults settings for `cxxflags` were used. For example

`
.../bin/mpic++   ...  -DMUMPS_5_0 -std=c++11 -O2 -g -DNDEBUG -fPIC   .../Amesos_Status.cpp
`

### Steps to reproduce the issue

We configured Trinitite to only see one compiler, then we built Trilinos:
```console
$ spack install trilinos
```

### Information on your system

This example was created on LANL's Trinitite machine. The compiler configuration was recorded as:
```
$ spack config get compilers
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
      cxxflags: -O3
    modules:
    - PrgEnv-intel
    - intel/17.0.4
    - craype-haswell
    operating_system: CNL
    paths:
      cc: cc
      cxx: CC
      f77: ftn
      fc: ftn
    spec: intel@17.0.4
    target: any
```

Insights and suggestions are greatly appreciated.

/cc @KineticTheory
